name: H8
text: N/A - Small display on the front panel displays the registers content.
description:
This early computer was to be used with a terminal for better control.

A lots of expansion boards were available for this computer. Memory boards were available in 4K, 8K, and 16K (note: 4k memory board was 8k half populated.)

The H8 was sold with software: Benton Harbor BASIC, the HASL-8 2 pass assembler, TED-8 Line oriented text editor and BUG-8 terminal console debugger.
_______________________

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPLETE SYSTEM</strong></font><br><blockquote>Complete system with H9 terminal and paper tape reader / punch expansion</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> COMPLETE SYSTEM #2</strong></font><br><blockquote>Here is a Heathkit H8 computer with a terminal and a floppy-drive.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> INSIDE</strong></font><br><blockquote>We can see here the different boards of the computer. The second board from bottom is a 64k RAM expansion board.</blockquote>

advert.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> U.S. ADVERT (1980)</strong></font><br><blockquote>At the time of this advert (September 1980), Heathkit introduced a music synthetiser board, a speech lab, a color graphic board, a color monitor and Microsoft BASIC and FORTRAN languages. </blockquote>

emulator.name: Project 8080
emulator.description: A H8 emulator for the Mac
